tool.name: Bin.seqs
tool.command: mothur_wrapper.py --cmd='bin.seqs' --result='^mothur.\S+\.logfile$:'$logfile --outputdir='$logfile.extra_files_path' --datasetid='$logfile.id' --new_file_path='$__new_file_path__' --new_datasets='^\S+?\.(unique|[0-9.]*)\.fasta$:${fasta.ext}' --fasta="$fasta" --list="$otu" #if $name.__str__ != "None" and len($name.__str__) > 0: --name="$name" #end if #if $label.__str__ != "None" and len($label.__str__) > 0: --label='$label' #end if #if $group.__str__ != "None" and len($group.__str__) > 0: --group='$group' #end if #if $count.__str__ != "None" and len($count.__str__) > 0: --count='$count' #end if

param.name: count
param.label: count - Represents the number of duplicate sequences for a given representitive sequence

tool.help:
@MOTHUR_OVERVIEW@
**Command Documenation**
The bin.seqs_ command generates fasta-formatted files where sequences are ordered according to the OTU from the list_file_ that they belong to. Such an output may be helpful for generating primers specific to an OTU or for classification of sequences.
.. _list_file: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/List_file .. _bin.seqs: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Bin.seqs
